content.description: new route around the corner on the right side of the tight canyon area as you drive further in. Can see route from pull-off in tight part of canyon by the right turn. Route is in the shade so good for summer.
content.location: Away from main routes/area to the left and on the backside of the main wall.

content.description: Pull your way through the first 10ft on huge holes! These are a distinctive feature to start the route. The rock starts out sharp but up higher has been smoothed by water running out of the hole at the top. That's where the name comes from. Crux is high - lots of sloppers but a few sharp edges get you through. THIS ROUTE IS NOT BY THE OTHER CLIMBS! Far Far left by itself...
content.location: Far-left side of the main wall and around the corner on your right when you pass through the narrow section of the canyon where the road turns right. Mostly in the shade and looks across at the routes on the left side of the narrow section of the road. Directly across the road from the pull-off on your left after passing through the narrow section of the canyon.

content.description: Start on same flake as Barley There start. After second bolt traverse right onto face. The upper face is well worth the climb.
content.location: Hummingbird Rock. Same starting location as Barely There climb.

content.description: First pitch begins at bottom right of Mane Wall (the wall of unbroken rock). Diagnol up and left an easy 5.2 following 3 bolts to a ledge. Belay here with a medium cam and bolt. Start on the gold bolt, all the way left, up a fun exposed face.
content.location: Mane Wall. Start at the bottom right of the big wall.

content.description: Good sequence of moves heading up the middle of the slab. Very well protected.
content.location: Phlox Rock. The southern most dome in the Horse Creek area with bolts. Misfire is the second climb from the right, up the face.

content.description: Start on hollow flake (be careful). Continue straight up, keeping right of large vegetated crack.
content.location: Hummingbird Rock. 100 feet left of Phlox Rock. Identified as long slab split with large vegetated cracks, hollow flake at bottom.

content.description: If you’ve only got 8 hours on your day off in Dubois, you have no belayer, and you’re up for a solo challenge this is what you’re looking for. Follow the ridge up and left from the base until you cut right under a roof like feature (the crux) then continue up and left. While some of the rock is solid, some is most certainly not; knock/kick holds before you trust them if you’re soloing. Some potential for gear but it would likely pull out with a fall anyway, and the drag would be unbearable after the roof. Bring a pair of descent shoes because the walk off (far left when you top out) is super uncomfortable in climbing shors.
content.location: Where horse creek road turns to the right and there is cliff on both sides, park in the pull off on the left side of the road. Keep walking into horse creek road for 2-3 minutes and it will be up on your right.
